modName: TERA Armors Collection for Skyrim - Mage Balance patch
summary: A tiny esp (non replacer) that streamlines and balances the Mage items created by asianboy345 in his fantastic work!
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][b][u]Description

[/u][/b][/size]This balance patch aims to provide a better experience when using the Mage items found in [size=3][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2113195/?]asianboy345's[/url][/b][/size] excellent work ([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25846/?]TERA Armors Collection for Skyrim - Male and UNP female[/url]).

This patch was initially created by me for personal use. In particular, I liked the upgrade paths provided by asianboy but always found the Robes and hoods to be extremely imbalanced. It was also confusing to find non-streamlined/random material requirements for many of the robes. Some very powerful items were available very early on in the game due to easy-to-find materials while other weaker items were locked out until many levels later on. It was also a bit unimmersive and counter-intuitive that you had to invest into 100 smithing with all perks obtained (!) to create Mage items.

And thus, this patch was born and I thought I would share it with everyone that feels the same way I do about the balance!

[u]A summary of changes:[/u]

[list]
[*]Nothing complicated/dangerous was touched. This patch was also created with compatibility and safety in mind.
[*]Perk requirements for crafting and tempering all Mage items were removed.
[*]Items separated into 5 tiers, based on power and cost.
[*]Un-enchanted Robes are much easier to craft, except for the 2 strongest ones.
[*]Boots/gloves/hoods(they are actually invisible circlets) are very easy to craft.
[*]Fixed a couple of issues with consistency, namely with the Nightwinder robe (you can now actually craft it!).
[*]All items were re-evaluated to be much more balanced (no specific formula was used, but their worth is more in line with their cost).
[*]Removed all Spell School cost reduction effects. This was done with Perk & Spell overhaul mods in mind. But trust me, you will really like the high-tier Robes! (Since you can now comfortably craft the un-enchanted versions, you can just use those instead and self-enchant!)
[*]Diversified (a bit) the material requirements for the upgrade paths. You'd better stock up on Linen, Leather, Gold coins and Soul Gems!
[*]The 2 strongest robes (Divinesight and Eternal Magus, Tier 5) are excellent alternatives to the Archmage Robes!
[/list]
[size=3][b]For a more comprehensive list of changes, please read the included README!


[i]Update : Please use the updated v1.1 (replace the old) file for better recipe visibility for the Eternal Magus and Divinesight robes. Two entirely new materials have been added under Misc at the forge![/i][/b][/size]

[u][size=5]Compatibility
[/size][/u]
Maximum possible. This patch should be compatible with any mod unless proven otherwise! [i]It should also be a very nice addition to the absolutely amazing [/i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59849/?]Perkus Maximus[/url][i] by [/i][size=3]t3ndo[/size][i] since [/i][b]all Cost Reductions were removed[/b][i]![/i]

[size=5][b][u]Requirements[/u][/b]
[/size]
[list=1]
[*][size=3]Latest Skyrim version (should be 1.9.32 something)[/size]
[*][size=3]Unofficial Skyrim patch(es) ; you should have them anyways![/size]
[*][size=3]asianboy345's original mod (found [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25846/?]here[/url])[/size]
[*][size=3]Any requirements the original mod has.[/size]
[*][size=3]All DLC (Dawnguard/Dragonborn/Hearthfire)[/size]
[/list]
[size=5][b][u]Installation

[/u][/b][/size][size=3]Manual : Just put the esp file in your Skyrim Data directory (Skyrim/Data) like all esp files!
[/size]
[size=3][b]NMM : Download the file and activate it![/b][/size]

[b][u][size=5]Load order

[/size][/u][/b][size=3]Pretty standard![/size] You want to place this [b][i]after[/i][/b] [u]TERAArmors.esm[/u] and any other overhauls/patches/etc [b][size=3]BUT[/size][/b] [u][b]before your Bashed Patch and Dynamic Patches[/b][/u] of course!

[b][i][size=3]An example load order :

[/size][/i][/b]Skyrim.esm
esm
esm
TERAARmors.esm
mods
mods
...
TERAArmorsPatch.esp
BashedPatch
DynamicPatches (ASIS,Dual Sheath,Patchus Maximus etc)


[b][u][size=5]Credits

[/size][/u][/b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2113195/?]asianboy345[/url] - Thank you for a great mod! :)
Luxrias - Author and modding newbie


[b][u]Notes

[/u][/b]This is the first..."mod" I have ever created! I sincerely hope it works for everyone and people find it useful and fun! [u]I will provide support if possible but I am by no means a modding expert - all I have learned was through trial and error and through great text/video guides found here in the Nexus![/u]

[b][u][size=5]Enjoy and thanks![/size][/u][/b]
